page.title: 15HOUSES
page.content: The older houses in Risca are mainly made natural stone from the nearby quarries.But like thr rest of the country,the newer houses are made of red or other coloured brick.Risca was a very small town surrounded by hill and field,until in the last 25 years they started developing one of the biggest housing estates in the area.Which has doubled the population of Risca.Most of the houses are teraced,mostly two bedroomed without side tiolets.Most of the council houses are peblle-dashed,with steel window frames and vary from two to four bedrooms. A lot of the houses still use coal for heating. All the old houses had slate rooves.even the newer houses are built with chimneys.Alot of people are now having their houses modernised by having replacement windows and doors.
